misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm.
description: The use of the RSA algorithm in this code is not secure. RSA with a key size of 1024 bits is considered insecure and can be easily broken. It is recommended to use a secure algorithm with a larger key size, such as AES.
recommendation: Replace the RSA algorithm with a secure algorithm, such as AES, and increase the key size to at least 2048 bits.
